storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to perform role creation to achieve tailored user access management

functional.title: Verify successful creation of a new role with unique name and assigned permissions
preconditions: Administrator is logged in with valid admin credentials
Administrator is on the Role Management section of the application
Database has existing roles table with at least one role
No role with the name 'Content Manager' exists in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the Role Management section from the admin dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Role Management page loads successfully displaying existing roles in a table format

steps.action: Click the 'Create New Role' button located in the top-right corner of the page
steps.expectedResult: Role creation form modal opens with fields for 'Role Name' and 'Permissions' checkboxes

steps.action: Enter 'Content Manager' in the 'Role Name' text field
steps.expectedResult: Text 'Content Manager' appears in the Role Name field without validation errors

steps.action: Select permissions checkboxes: 'View Content', 'Edit Content', and 'Publish Content' from the available permissions list
steps.expectedResult: Selected checkboxes display checkmarks and are highlighted in blue

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button at the bottom of the role creation form
steps.expectedResult: Form submits, loading spinner appears briefly, and green confirmation banner displays message 'Role "Content Manager" created successfully' at the top of the page

steps.action: Verify the newly created role appears in the roles table
steps.expectedResult: Role 'Content Manager' is visible in the roles table with assigned permissions 'View Content, Edit Content, Publish Content' displayed in the permissions column

postconditions: New role 'Content Manager' is saved in the roles table in the database
Role creation activity is logged in the audit log with timestamp, admin username, and action details
Administrator remains on the Role Management page with the modal closed
Role creation form is reset and ready for another entry

preconditions: Administrator is authenticated and logged into the system
Administrator is on the Role Management page

steps.action: Click the 'Create New Role' button on the Role Management page
steps.expectedResult: Role creation form opens immediately within 500ms

steps.action: Enter 'Marketing Manager' in the Role Name field and select permissions: 'View Analytics', 'Export Reports'
steps.expectedResult: Form fields populate instantly without lag

steps.action: Start a timer and click the 'Submit' button to create the role
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator appears immediately

steps.action: Observe the time taken from clicking Submit until the confirmation message appears
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message 'Role "Marketing Manager" created successfully' appears within 2 seconds, timer shows elapsed time less than 2000ms

steps.action: Verify the new role appears in the roles table
steps.expectedResult: Role 'Marketing Manager' is immediately visible in the table with correct permissions

postconditions: Role creation completed within the 2-second performance requirement
Role 'Marketing Manager' is persisted in the database
Performance metrics are logged for monitoring
System remains responsive for subsequent operations

steps.action: Click browser back button or attempt to navigate away from the page
steps.expectedResult: Same unsaved changes warning appears, preventing accidental data loss

steps.action: Successfully create the role 'Project Manager' and observe confirmation
steps.expectedResult: Success message displays with 'Undo' option available for 10 seconds: 'Role created successfully. Undo?'

steps.action: Click 'Undo' link within the time window
steps.expectedResult: Role 'Project Manager' is immediately deleted, confirmation message appears 'Role creation undone', user returns to roles list without the new role

steps.action: Navigate to role management section and verify breadcrumb navigation
steps.expectedResult: Breadcrumb trail shows 'Dashboard > Administration > Role Management' with each segment clickable for easy navigation back

postconditions: User can exit role creation workflow at any point without system errors
No orphaned data exists from cancelled operations
Undo action is logged in audit trail

Recommendations: Implement auto-save draft functionality every 30 seconds, provide clear exit points on every screen, add keyboard shortcuts (ESC to cancel, Ctrl+S to save), display unsaved changes indicator, allow undo for at least 10 seconds after creation, provide 'Save as Draft' option for complex forms, ensure consistent placement of Cancel/Submit buttons across all forms

usability.title: Evaluate error message clarity and recovery guidance for role creation failures
usability.subCategory: Nielsen-H09-Help Users Recognize and Recover from Errors
usability.description: Test that error messages are expressed in plain language (no error codes alone), precisely indicate the problem, and constructively suggest solutions. Administrators should be able to quickly understand what went wrong and how to fix it without technical knowledge.
preconditions: Administrator has access to role management functionality
Test environment can simulate various error conditions
Existing role 'Administrator' exists in the system

steps.action: Attempt to create a role with name 'Administrator' (duplicate of existing role)
steps.expectedResult: Error message displays in plain language: 'A role with the name Administrator already exists. Please choose a different name or modify the existing role.' (NOT 'Error Code: 409 - Conflict')

steps.action: Simulate network timeout by disconnecting network during role creation submission
steps.expectedResult: User-friendly error appears: 'Unable to create role due to connection issue. Please check your internet connection and try again.' with 'Retry' button that preserves entered data

steps.action: Simulate database error (e.g., database connection failure) during role creation
steps.expectedResult: Error message states: 'We're experiencing technical difficulties. Your role could not be created. Please try again in a few moments or contact support if the problem persists.' with support contact information visible

steps.action: Enter role name with only spaces '    ' and attempt to submit
steps.expectedResult: Validation error displays: 'Role name cannot be empty or contain only spaces. Please enter a valid role name (e.g., Sales Manager, Content Editor)' with examples provided

steps.action: Attempt to create role when session has expired (simulate timeout)
steps.expectedResult: Clear message appears: 'Your session has expired for security reasons. Please log in again to continue.' with automatic redirect to login page that returns to role creation after re-authentication

steps.action: Review error message styling and placement across all error scenarios
steps.expectedResult: All error messages use consistent styling (red/warning color), appear near the relevant field or at top of form, include appropriate icons (warning/error symbol), and remain visible until user takes corrective action

postconditions: All error scenarios provide actionable recovery steps
No technical jargon or raw error codes are exposed to users
Form data is preserved after recoverable errors

Recommendations: Use plain language without technical codes, provide specific solutions not generic messages, include examples of correct input format, offer 'Retry' buttons for transient errors, preserve user input after errors, use appropriate visual hierarchy (icons, colors) for error severity, link to help documentation for complex errors, log detailed technical errors server-side for developers while showing friendly messages to users
usability.testData: Test Scenarios: Duplicate name 'Administrator', Network timeout simulation, Database error simulation, Invalid input '    ', Session expiration

reliability.title: Database Connection Failure During Role Creation - Transaction Rollback and Recovery
reliability.description: Validate system behavior when database connection fails mid-transaction during role creation. Ensure transaction rollback, data integrity, no partial role creation, and graceful error handling with recovery within acceptable MTTR.
preconditions: Administrator is authenticated with admin privileges
Role management API endpoint POST /api/roles is operational
Database connection monitoring is enabled
Chaos engineering tool (e.g., Chaos Monkey, Gremlin) is configured
Baseline steady state: Role creation success rate > 95%, response time < 2s

steps.action: Establish baseline steady state by creating 10 test roles successfully and verify 100% success rate
steps.expectedResult: All 10 roles created successfully within 2 seconds each, confirmed in roles table

steps.action: Inject database connection failure using chaos tool immediately after role creation POST request is initiated but before transaction commit
steps.expectedResult: Database connection is terminated, simulating network partition or database crash

steps.action: Monitor system response and verify transaction rollback occurs automatically
steps.expectedResult: Transaction is rolled back, no partial role data persists in database, roles table remains in consistent state

steps.action: Verify API returns appropriate error response (HTTP 503 Service Unavailable or 500 Internal Server Error) with meaningful error message
steps.expectedResult: API returns error code with message indicating temporary unavailability, no sensitive database information exposed

steps.action: Restore database connection and measure MTTR (Mean Time To Recovery)
steps.expectedResult: System automatically detects database availability within 30 seconds, connection pool recovers

steps.action: Retry the same role creation request after recovery
steps.expectedResult: Role is created successfully within 2 seconds, confirming system has fully recovered to steady state

steps.action: Verify audit logs capture the failure event, rollback action, and recovery timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Complete audit trail exists showing failure, rollback, and successful retry with timestamps for compliance

postconditions: Database is restored to operational state
No orphaned or partial role records exist
System returns to baseline steady state performance
All chaos injection configurations are removed
toolsRequired: Chaos Engineering tool (Gremlin, Chaos Monkey, or Toxiproxy)

reliability.title: API Service Resource Exhaustion - Memory Leak Simulation and Circuit Breaker Activation
reliability.description: Hypothesis: When role creation API service experiences memory exhaustion (>90% memory usage), circuit breaker should open within 10 seconds, preventing cascading failures while maintaining system availability for other services. System should recover when memory is released.
preconditions: Role management microservice is deployed with circuit breaker pattern implemented
Memory monitoring and alerting configured with 90% threshold
Circuit breaker configured with failure threshold of 50% over 10 requests
Load balancer with health check endpoint configured
Steady state baseline: API response time < 2s, success rate > 95%, memory usage < 70%

steps.action: Establish steady state by sending 50 concurrent role creation requests and measure baseline metrics
steps.expectedResult: All requests complete successfully, average response time < 2s, memory usage stable at ~60-70%, success rate 100%

steps.action: Inject memory leak chaos by triggering memory exhaustion on role management service (simulate memory leak to 95% usage)
steps.expectedResult: Service memory consumption increases to 95%, response times begin degrading beyond 2 seconds

steps.action: Continue sending role creation requests (20 requests) and monitor circuit breaker state transitions
steps.expectedResult: Circuit breaker detects failure threshold (>50% failures or timeouts), transitions from CLOSED to OPEN state within 10 seconds

steps.action: Verify blast radius containment - attempt role creation requests while circuit breaker is OPEN
steps.expectedResult: Requests fail fast with HTTP 503 and circuit breaker error message, no requests reach degraded service, other system services remain operational

steps.action: Release memory pressure and allow service to recover, monitor circuit breaker transition to HALF-OPEN state
steps.expectedResult: Memory usage drops below 70%, circuit breaker transitions to HALF-OPEN after configured timeout (30-60 seconds), allows limited test requests

steps.action: Send test requests in HALF-OPEN state and verify successful processing
steps.expectedResult: Test requests succeed with response time < 2s, circuit breaker transitions to CLOSED state, normal operation resumes

steps.action: Measure MTTR and validate SLO compliance: system recovery time and availability impact
steps.expectedResult: MTTR < 2 minutes from failure detection to full recovery, overall availability remains > 99.5% during incident

postconditions: Circuit breaker is in CLOSED state
Memory usage returned to normal baseline (< 70%)
All chaos configurations removed
Service health check returns healthy status
reliability.testData: Concurrent role creation requests with varying role names: 'LoadTest_Role_001' through 'LoadTest_Role_070'
toolsRequired: Circuit breaker monitoring dashboard (Hystrix Dashboard, Resilience4j)

reliability.title: Authentication Service Dependency Failure - Graceful Degradation and Retry with Exponential Backoff
reliability.description: Validate system resilience when authentication service (required for admin verification) becomes unavailable. Test retry logic with exponential backoff, timeout handling, and graceful error messaging without exposing security vulnerabilities.
preconditions: Role creation requires admin authentication via external authentication service
Retry policy configured with exponential backoff (initial: 1s, max: 16s, max attempts: 4)
Connection timeout set to 5 seconds
Authentication service health monitoring enabled
Steady state: Authentication success rate > 99%, latency < 500ms

steps.action: Verify steady state by successfully authenticating and creating 5 roles with valid admin credentials
steps.expectedResult: All authentication requests succeed within 500ms, all 5 roles created successfully

steps.action: Inject authentication service failure using network partition or service shutdown
steps.expectedResult: Authentication service becomes unreachable, health check reports service down

steps.action: Attempt role creation with valid admin credentials and monitor retry behavior
steps.expectedResult: System attempts authentication with exponential backoff: 1st retry after 1s, 2nd after 2s, 3rd after 4s, 4th after 8s, total 4 attempts within 15 seconds

steps.action: Verify timeout handling and error response after all retry attempts exhausted
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 503 Service Unavailable with message 'Authentication service temporarily unavailable, please try again later' without exposing internal service details

steps.action: Verify no role is created in database when authentication fails
steps.expectedResult: Roles table shows no new entries, maintaining data integrity and security posture

steps.action: Restore authentication service and immediately retry the same role creation request
steps.expectedResult: Authentication succeeds on first attempt, role is created successfully within 2 seconds total (including auth time)

steps.action: Validate audit logs capture authentication failures, retry attempts, and eventual success with proper timestamps
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains entries for each retry attempt with timestamps, final failure, and subsequent success after service restoration

postconditions: Authentication service is fully operational
No unauthorized role creation occurred during service outage
Retry mechanism reset to initial state
All chaos configurations removed

reliability.title: Concurrent Role Creation Conflict - Data Integrity and Unique Constraint Validation Under Load
reliability.description: Validate data integrity when multiple administrators attempt to create roles with identical names simultaneously. Ensure unique constraint enforcement, proper transaction isolation, no race conditions, and consistent error handling under concurrent load.
preconditions: Database unique constraint configured on role_name column
Transaction isolation level set to READ_COMMITTED or higher
Role creation API supports concurrent requests
Database connection pool configured with minimum 20 connections
Steady state: Role creation success rate 95%, no duplicate roles exist

steps.action: Establish baseline by creating 10 unique roles sequentially and verify all succeed without conflicts
steps.expectedResult: All 10 roles created successfully, each with unique name, no database constraint violations

steps.action: Simulate concurrent role creation by sending 50 simultaneous POST requests with identical role name 'ConcurrentTest_Role' from different admin sessions
steps.expectedResult: All 50 requests are received and processed concurrently by the API service

steps.action: Verify exactly ONE role creation succeeds and 49 requests fail with appropriate conflict error
steps.expectedResult: Database contains exactly 1 role named 'ConcurrentTest_Role', unique constraint enforced successfully

steps.action: Validate error responses for failed requests return HTTP 409 Conflict with message indicating role name already exists
steps.expectedResult: 49 failed requests receive HTTP 409 with clear error message: 'Role name already exists', no HTTP 500 errors occur

steps.action: Verify no deadlocks or transaction timeouts occurred during concurrent processing
steps.expectedResult: Database logs show no deadlock detection, all transactions completed or rolled back cleanly within 5 seconds

steps.action: Repeat test with 100 concurrent requests creating 10 different role names (10 requests per role name) to validate consistent behavior under higher load
steps.expectedResult: Exactly 10 roles created (one per unique name), 90 requests fail with HTTP 409, no data corruption, response time < 3 seconds for 95th percentile

steps.action: Query database to verify data integrity: no duplicate role names, all role records complete with proper timestamps and audit fields
steps.expectedResult: Database integrity check passes, all roles have unique names, complete data, proper created_by and created_at values

postconditions: Database contains only unique role names
No orphaned or incomplete role records exist
Connection pool returned to normal state
Test roles cleaned up from database
reliability.testData: Role names: 'ConcurrentTest_Role' (50 concurrent), then 'Role_A' through 'Role_J' (10 requests each), Permissions: ['READ_USERS']

userStoryObject.title: As Administrator, I want to perform role creation to achieve tailored user access management
userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND: The need for tailored user access management arises from the diverse roles within the organization that require different levels of access to resources. CURRENT STATE: Currently, user access is managed manually, leading to potential security risks and inefficiencies. DESIRED STATE: With the implementation of role creation, administrators can efficiently manage user access based on defined roles. KEY FUNCTIONALITY: â€¢ Create new roles with specific permissions. â€¢ Modify existing roles as needed. â€¢ Delete roles that are no longer relevant. â€¢ Log all role management activities for compliance. USER INTERACTION FLOW: 1. Administrator navigates to the role management section. 2. Administrator selects the option to create a new role. 3. Administrator inputs role name and assigns permissions. 4. Administrator submits the role creation form. 5. System validates the input and creates the role. 6. Confirmation message is displayed. TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS: â€¢ Data source: Roles table in the database. â€¢ Validation rules: Ensure role names are unique. â€¢ API endpoints: POST /api/roles for role creation. â€¢ Security: Role management actions require admin authentication. â€¢ Performance: Role creation should complete within 2 seconds. OUT OF SCOPE: â€¢ Role assignment to users. SUCCESS METRICS: â€¢ 90% of roles created without errors within the first month.

Persona: Administrator (Administrator)
userStoryObject.acceptanceCriteria:
Criteria 1: System allows administrators to create new roles with unique names and assigned permissions.

Criteria 2: System displays a confirmation message upon successful role creation.

Criteria 3: System logs the role creation activity for audit purposes.

Criteria 4: System prevents the creation of roles with duplicate names.
